bank.description:
You are dealing with a problem of predicting whether a customer subscribes to a term deposit or not based on the following features.
# bank client features:
1 - age (numeric)
2 - type of job (categorical: "admin.", "unknown", "unemployed", "management", "housemaid", "entrepreneur", "student", "blue-collar", "self-employed", "retired", "technician", "services") 
3 - marital status (categorical: "married","divorced","single"; note: "divorced" means divorced or widowed)
4 - education (categorical: "unknown", "secondary", "primary", "tertiary")
5 - has credit in default? (binary: "yes", "no")
6 - average yearly balance, in euros (numeric) 
7 - has housing loan? (binary: "yes", "no")
8 - has personal loan? (binary: "yes", "no")
# related with the last contact of the current campaign:
9 - contact communication type (categorical: "unknown", "telephone", "cellular") 
10 - last contact day of the month (numeric)
11 - last contact month of year (categorical: "jan", "feb", "mar", ..., "nov", "dec")
12 - last contact duration, in seconds (numeric)
# other attributes:
13 - number of contacts performed during this campaign and for this client (numeric, includes last contact)
14 - number of days that passed by after the client was last contacted from a previous campaign (numeric, -1 means client was not previously contacted)
15 - number of contacts performed before this campaign and for this client (numeric)
16 - outcome of the previous marketing campaign (categorical: "unknown", "other", "failure", "success")
bank.title: Title: Deposit subscription prediction
bank.description_brief: This data is related with direct marketing campaigns of a Portuguese banking institution. The marketing campaigns were based on phone calls. The classification goal is to predict if the client will subscribe a term deposit.
bank.question: Does this client subscribe to a term deposit?
bank.answer_requirement_brief: Answer the question with either Yes or No.
bank.answer_requirement: Answer the question with either 'Yes' or 'No' (without quotes).
bank.trend: Please distill the key trends that may assist an AI model in making future predictions. Output trends only without any further explanations.
bank.summarization: Tl;dr / Summarize the rules into a small set of non-conflicting and complementary patterns for predicting whether a client would subscribe to a term deposit. Output patterns only without any further explanations.

blood.description:
You are dealing with a problem of predicting whether a blood donator returns for another donation based on the following features:
1. Recency - months since last donation (numeric)
2. Frequency - total number of donation (numeric)
3. Monetary - total blood donated in c.c. (numeric)
4. Time - months since first donation (numeric)
blood.title: Title: Blood donation prediction
blood.description_brief: This data is to predict whether a given individual will consent or avoid donating blood.
blood.question: Will the person donate blood?
blood.answer_requirement_brief: Answer the question with either Yes or No.
blood.answer_requirement: Answer the question with either 'Yes' or 'No' (without quotes).
blood.trend: Please distill the key trends that may assist an AI model in making future predictions. Output trends only without any further explanations.
blood.summarization: Tl;dr / Summarize the rules into a small set of non-conflicting and complementary patterns for predicting whether a person would donate blood. Output patterns only without any further explanations.

calhousing.description:
You are dealing with a problem of predicting whether the house value of district is below or above the median based on the following features:
1. median income - median income of residents in the district (numeric)
2. median age - median age of residents in the district (numeric)
3. total rooms - total number of rooms in the district (numeric)
4. total bedrooms - total number of bedrooms in the district (numeric)
5. population - population in the district (numeric)
6. households - total number of households in the district (numeric)
7. latitude - latitude of the district (numeric)
8. longitude - longitude of the district (numeric)
calhousing.title: Title: House value prediction
calhousing.description_brief: This dataset is collected on the variables using all the block groups in California from the 1990 Census. It computes distances among the centroids of each block group as measured in latitude and longitude, aims to predict whether the house value of district is below or above the median.
calhousing.question: Is this house block valuable?
calhousing.answer_requirement_brief: Answer the question with either Yes or No.
calhousing.answer_requirement: Answer the question with either 'Yes' or 'No' (without quotes).
calhousing.trend: Please distill the key trends that may assist an AI model in making future predictions. Output trends only without any further explanations.
calhousing.summarization: Tl;dr / Summarize the rules into a small set of non-conflicting and complementary patterns for predicting whether a house block is valuable. Output patterns only without any further explanations.

car.description:
You are dealing with a problem of evaluating the state (Unacceptable/Acceptable/Good/Very Good) of each car based on the following features:
1. Buying price (categorical: "v-high", "high", "med", "low")
2. Doors - number of doors (categorical: "2", "3", "4", "5-more")
3. Mainteance costs - price of the maintenance (categorical: "v-high", "high", "med", "low")
4. Persons -  capacity in terms of persons to carry (categorical: "2", "4", "more")
5. Safety score - estimated safety of the car (categorical: "low", "med", "high")
6. Trunk size - the size of luggage boot (categorical: "small", "med", "big")
car.title: Title: Car safety prediction
car.description_brief: This dataset was derived from a simple hierarchical decision model originally developed for the demonstration of DEX. The goal is to evaluate the safety of cars.
car.question: How would you rate the decision to buy this car?
car.answer_requirement_brief: Answer the question with one of [Unacceptable, Acceptable, Good, Very Good].
car.answer_requirement: Answer the question with either 'Unacceptable', 'Acceptable', 'Good', or 'Very Good' (without quotes).
car.trend: Please distill the key trends that may assist an AI model in making future predictions. Output trends only without any further explanations.
car.summarization: Tl;dr / Summarize the rules into a small set of non-conflicting and complementary patterns for rating the decision to buy a car. Output patterns only without any further explanations.

creditg.description:
You are dealing with a problem of predicting whether a person has good or bad risk for receiving a credit based on the following features:
1. Status of existing checking account (categorical: "<0", "0<=X<200", ">=200", "no checking")
2. Duration in month (numeric)
3. Credit history (categorical: "no credits/all paid", "all paid", "existing paid", "delayed previously", "critical/other existing credit")
4. Purpose (categorical: "new car", "used car", "furniture/equipment", "radio/tv", 'domestic appliance", "repairs", "education", "vacation", "retraining", "business", "other")
5. Credit amount (numeric)
6. Savings account/bonds (categorical: "<100", "100<=X<500", "500<=X<1000", ">=1000", "no known savings")
7. Present employment since (categorical: "unemployed", "<1", "1<=X<4", "4<=X<7", ">=7")
8. Installment rate in percentage of disposable income (numeric)
9. Personal status and sex (categorical: "male div/sep", "female div/dep/mar", "male single", "male mar/wid", "female single")
10. Other debtors / guarantors (categorical: "none", "co applicant", "guarantor")
11. Present residence since (numeric)
12. Property (categorical: "real estate", "life insurance", "car", "no known property")
13. Age in years (numeric)
14. Other installment plans (categorical: "bank", "stores", "none")
15. Housing (categorical: "rent", "own", "for free")
16. Number of existing credits at this bank (numeric)
17. Job (categorical: "unemp/unskilled non res", "unskilled resident", "skilled", "high qualif/self emp/mgmt")
18. Number of people being liable to provide maintenance for (numeric)
19. Telephone (categorical: "none", "yes")
20. foreign worker (categorical: "yes", "no")
creditg.title: Title: Credit risk prediction
creditg.description_brief: This dataset originates from the UCI Machine Learning Repository. It is used to classify individuals as good or bad credit risks based on various attributes.
creditg.question: Does this person receive a credit?
creditg.answer_requirement_brief: Answer the question with either Yes or No.
creditg.answer_requirement: Answer the question with either 'Yes' or 'No' (without quotes).
creditg.trend: Please distill the key trends that may assist an AI model in making future predictions. Output trends only without any further explanations.
creditg.summarization: Tl;dr / Summarize the rules into a small set of non-conflicting and complementary patterns for predicting whether a person would receive a credit. Output patterns only without any further explanations.

diabetes.description:
You are dealing with a problem of predicting whether a woman has diabete based on the following features:
1. Age (numeric)
2. Number of times pregnant (numeric)
3. Diastolic blood pressure (numeric)
4. Triceps skin fold thickness (numeric)
5. Plasma glucose concentration at 2 hours in an oral glucose tolerance test (GTT) (numeric)
6. 2-hour serum insulin (numeric)
7. Body mass index (numeric)
8. Diabetes pedigree function (numeric)
diabetes.title: Title: Diabetes risk prediction
diabetes.description_brief: This dataset is originally from the National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases. The objective is to predict based on diagnostic measurements whether a patient has high/low risk of developing diabetes.
diabetes.question: Does this patient have diabetes?
diabetes.answer_requirement_brief: Answer the question with either Yes or No.
diabetes.answer_requirement: Answer the question with either 'Yes' or 'No' (without quotes).
diabetes.trend: Please distill the key trends that may assist an AI model in making future predictions. Output trends only without any further explanations.
diabetes.summarization: Tl;dr / Summarize the rules into a small set of non-conflicting and complementary patterns for predicting whether a patient has diabetes. Output patterns only without any further explanations.

heart.description:
You are dealing with a problem of predicting whether a patient has coronary artery disease based on the following features:
1. Age of the patient [years]
2. Sex of the patient [M: Male, F: Female]
3. Chest pain type [TA: Typical Angina, ATA: Atypical Angina, NAP: Non-Anginal Pain, ASY: Asymptomatic]
4. Resting blood pressure [mm Hg]
5. Serum cholesterol [mm/dl]
6. Fasting blood sugar > 120 mg/dl [1: if FastingBS > 120 mg/dl, 0: otherwise]
7. Resting electrocardiogram results [Normal: Normal, ST: having ST-T wave abnormality (T wave inversions and/or ST elevation or depression of > 0.05 mV), LVH: showing probable or definite left ventricular hypertrophy by Estes' criteria]
8. Maximum heart rate achieved [Numeric value between 60 and 202]
9. Exercise-induced angina [Y: Yes, N: No]
10. ST depression induced by exercise relative to rest [Numeric value measured in depression]
11. Slope of the peak exercise ST segment [Up: upsloping, Flat: flat, Down: downsloping]
heart.title: Title: Heart disease prediction
heart.description_brief: This dataset contains 11 features that can be used to predict a possible heart disease.
heart.question: Does the coronary angiography of this patient show a heart disease?
heart.answer_requirement_brief: Answer the question with either Yes or No.
heart.answer_requirement: Answer the question with either 'Yes' or 'No' (without quotes).
heart.trend: Please distill the key trends that may assist an AI model in making future predictions. Output trends only without any further explanations.
heart.summarization: Tl;dr / Summarize the rules into a small set of non-conflicting and complementary patterns for predicting whether the coronary angiography of a patient shows a heart disease. Output patterns only without any further explanations.

income.description:
You are dealing with a problem of predicting whether each person has an annual income over $50k based on the following features:
1. Age (numeric)
2. Race (categorical: "White", "Asian-Pac-Islander", "Amer-Indian-Eskimo", "Other", "Black")
3. Sex (categorical: "Female", "Male")
4. Marital status (categorical: "Married-civ-spouse", "Divorced", "Never-married", "Separated", "Widowed", "Married-spouse-absent", "Married-AF-spouse")
5. Relation to head of the household (categorical: "Wife", "Own-child", "Husband", "Not-in-family", "Other-relative", "Unmarried")
6. Native country (categorical: "United-States", "Cambodia", "England", "Puerto-Rico", "Canada", "Germany", "Outlying-US(Guam-USVI-etc)", "India", "Japan", "Greece", 'South", "China", "Cuba", "Iran", "Honduras", "Philippines", "Italy", "Poland", "Jamaica", "Vietnam", "Mexico", "Portugal", "Ireland", "France", "Dominican-Republic", "Laos", "Ecuador", "Taiwan", "Haiti", "Columbia", "Hungary", "Guatemala", "Nicaragua", "Scotland", "Thailand", "Yugoslavia", "El-Salvador", "Trinadad&Tobago", "Peru", "Hong", "Holand-Netherlands")
7. Occupation (categorical: "Tech-support", "Craft-repair", "Other-service", "Sales", "Exec-managerial", "Prof-specialty", "Handlers-cleaners", "Machine-op-inspct", "Adm-clerical", "Farming-fishing", "Transport-moving", "Priv-house-serv", "Protective-serv", "Armed-Forces")
8. Work class (categorical: "Private", "Self-emp-not-inc", "Self-emp-inc", "Federal-gov", "Local-gov", "State-gov", "Without-pay", "Never-worked")
9. Capital gain last year (numeric)
10. Capital loss last year (numeric)
11. Education (categorical: "Bachelors", "Some-college", "11th", "HS-grad", "Prof-school", "Assoc-acdm", "Assoc-voc", "9th", "7th-8th", "12th", "Masters", "1st-4th", "10th", "Doctorate", "5th-6th", "Preschool")
12. Work hours per week (numeric)
income.title: Title: Income prediction
income.description_brief: This dataset predicts whether each person has an annual income over $50,000 based on some information about the person.
income.question: Does this person earn more than 50000 dollars per year?
income.answer_requirement_brief: Answer the question with either Yes or No.
income.answer_requirement: Answer the question with either 'Yes' or 'No' (without quotes).
income.trend: Please distill the key trends that may assist an AI model in making future predictions. Output trends only without any further explanations.
income.summarization: Tl;dr / Summarize the rules into a small set of non-conflicting and complementary patterns for predicting whether a person earns more than 50000 dollars per year. Output patterns only without any further explanations.

jungle.description:
You are dealing with a problem of predicting whether the white player will win a jungle chess game based on the following features:
1. white piece strength (numeric)
2. white piece file (numeric)
3. white piece rank (numeric)
4. black piece strength (numeric)
5. black piece file (numeric)
6. black piece rank (numeric)
jungle.title: Title: Game winning prediction
jungle.description_brief: This dataset predicts whether the white player will win based on some game information.
jungle.question: Does the white player win this two pieces endgame of Jungle Chess?
jungle.answer_requirement_brief: Answer the question with either Yes or No.
jungle.answer_requirement: Answer the question with either 'Yes' or 'No' (without quotes).
jungle.trend: Please distill the key trends that may assist an AI model in making future predictions. Output trends only without any further explanations.
jungle.summarization: Tl;dr / Summarize the rules into a small set of non-conflicting and complementary patterns for predicting whether the white player wins this two pieces endgame of Jungle Chess. Output patterns only without any further explanations.
